settings.floatingHud.placementDescriptio: Pick a preset corner or edge so the floating HUD always stays where you expect.
settings.floatingHud.placementStatus.top: HUD sticks to the top-left corner.
HUD stays centered along the top edge.
HUD anchors to the top-right corner.
settings.floatingHud.placementStatus.mid: HUD hugs the left edge at mid-height.
HUD hugs the right edge at mid-height.
settings.floatingHud.placementStatus.bot: HUD rests in the bottom-left corner.
HUD centers along the bottom edge.
HUD anchors to the bottom-right corner.
settings.clipboard.copyBack: Copy optimised image back to clipboard
settings.clipboard.copyFilePath: Also add the optimised file path to the clipboard (shows as text)
settings.output.replaceInPlace.subtitle: Overwrite the source file instead of creating a .clop copy.
settings.output.deleteConverted: Delete the original when formats change
settings.output.deleteConverted.subtitle: For example, remove the PNG after saving a converted JPEG.
settings.automation.folderSubtitle: Files saved in these folders are optimised automatically.
settings.optimisation.forceFullImage.sub: Skip the Windows fast path so Clop recompresses every image even when the original already looks optimal.
settings.optimisation.autoConvertDocumen: Uses LibreOffice (if available) to convert DOC, PPT, XLS, CSV, and similar files to PDF before optimisation.
settings.optimisation.videoPreset.title: Video encoder preset
settings.optimisation.videoPreset.subtit: Pick whether Clop should stay on the CPU or tap your AMD GPU for HEVC encodes.
settings.optimisation.videoPreset.auto.d: Detects available GPUs automatically and falls back to software when needed.
settings.optimisation.videoPreset.cpu.de: Forces libx264/libx265 so every export matches macOS even on systems without reliable GPUs.
settings.optimisation.videoPreset.gpuQua: Uses the full hevc_amf string (quality, transcoding, profile main, tier high, level 5.1, preanalysis, BF=3) with QVBR quality 23 for the smallest files.
settings.optimisation.videoPreset.gpuSim: Shorter command (-quality quality, -rc vbr_peak, -qvbr_quality 23, -bf 3) that still hits high quality without every toggle.
settings.optimisation.videoPreset.gpuCqp: Switches to -rc cqp with QP 22/24/26 for I/P/B frames so you get CPU-like detail and the absolute smallest outputs.
